overview: Students participate in staff-supervised ensembles as approved by the ensemble director.

Performers will develop their techniques as ensemble players and study selected repertoire to performance standard. Composers will develop their skills in writing for and working with ensembles, in rehearsal and concert.

All students enrolled in Honours Ensemble must register their ensemble via the Honours Ensemble registration form at theConservatorium Ensemble Enrolment & Participation Formspage no later than the end of week 2.
This subject is co-delivered with MUSI40080 Honours Ensemble 2. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-taught subjects in the same study period.
intended learning outcomes: show technical development as ensemble musicians;
participate with ability and self-confidence as a member of a performing group;
(for performers) perform selected repertoire to concert standard; (for composers) prepare and present a new work for performance;
identify and exhibit specific knowledge of a range of ensemble repertoire;
exhibit an informed respect for the values and principles of ensemble performance.

assessments.description: Weekly preparation of parts, individual and/or sectional practice and active contribution to all rehearsals and performances as directed. 56 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend 100% of all scheduled classes, rehearsals and performances as directed.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 72 hours, comprising weekly rehearsals during semester, and intensive rehearsal periods prior to concerts as directed.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 72 hours, comprising weekly rehearsals during semester, and intensive rehearsal periods prior to concerts as directed.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
